revised_title: Exploring Human Sensitivity to Square-Wave Spectral Power Distributions in Color Perception
tldr: Researchers measured the chromatic threshold sensitivity of human color perception using stimuli with spectral compositions determined by square-wave functions. They found maximum sensitivity around 1.5 cycles and a high-frequency cutoff at 3.6 cycles. The results were compared with three current psychophysical models of opponent-color processes, providing insights into color vision mechanisms.
